intro: Leiphaimos lutea, commonly known as the yellow leigh plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique coloration and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
